summary:
African Americans, or Black Americans, are an ethnic group with African ancestry. They are the second largest group in the U.S. after White Americans. Most descend from enslaved Africans brought to the U.S. in the 16th to 19th centuries. 

Enslaved on plantations, they gained freedom after the Civil War in 1865. Despite facing racism and segregation, they've made significant cultural contributions, especially in music. 

Today, African Americans are a diverse community, including descendants of enslaved people and recent immigrants from Africa and the Caribbean.
title: African Americans
